intro: Iozoste macrophylla, commonly known as the broad-leafed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to deep pink. The plant has broad, waxy leaves that are often arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Iozoste macrophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
